title: Bell'Antonio - Mauro Bolognini (1960)
description:
Directed by the comparatively unknown Mauro Bolognini, the Italian Bell&#039; Antonio is distinguished by its screenplay, cowritten by directorial giant Pier Paolo Pasolini. Marcello Mastroianni and Claudia Cardinale are happily married until she
finds out he&#039;s impotent. It takes her a year to find this out, which ought to give an indication of how seriously we&#039;re supposed to take this film. Also risible is the fact that Mastrioanni bears the reputation of a fabulous lover, as do practically all the members of his family. Nonetheless, he stands by like a dummy when Cardinale&#039;s father forces her to annul the marriage and wed another. It&#039;s all nonsense, of course, but Pasolini and his collaborators weave their tale so 
persuasively that one forgives the film&#039;s utter lack of credibility.
